sentence.Network_en: The nearside front tyre had been slashed.
It hit the kerb on the nearside and seemed to ricochet across the road on two wheels.
sentence.Network_cn: 车的左侧撞到路缘上，似乎飞弹了起来，靠两只车轮越过了马路。

entry.tran: (指车轮、车灯或车门)靠近路边的;(在英国指)左边的
entry.def: The nearside wheels, lights, or doors of a vehicle are those nearest the edge of the road when the vehicle is being driven on the correct side of the road. In Britain, the nearside is on the left.

example.ex: The nearside front tyre had been slashed.

entry.tran: (车辆)靠路边的一侧，内侧，左边
entry.def: The nearside of a vehicle is the side that is nearest the edge of the road when the vehicle is being driven on the correct side of the road.

example.ex: It hit the kerb on the nearside and seemed to ricochet across the road on two wheels.
example.tran: 车的左侧撞到路缘上，似乎飞弹了起来，靠两只车轮越过了马路。

means.word_mean: 1. the side of a vehicle nearest the kerb
